Patrick wrote:
> hi folks,
> 
> I have some serious doubts about how to test a JCA connector. The
> company I work for has developed this connector to an EIS written in
> C/C++. This JCA connector uses the Command design pattern in order to
> get/send and validate information on the EIS.
> 
> Now they have added two new commands to this connector and I'm
> supposed to test them. As it's legacy code, there are no junit tests
> and I will be the first one to write them but only for those new
> commands. My idea is to test the JCA connector out of the container
> and have a mock EIS since testing inside the container and connecting
> to the real EIS seems really painfull to me. :) 
> 
> However, I have no clue how to do that cause the code under test does
> not offer a way of receiving a mock object. This code instanciates all
> it needs within the Command method execute.
> 
> Is there any framework that could help me in this challenging
> situation? Something like simulating a fake container and EIS. I did
> some googling over the internet and also searched over this group but
> couldn't find anything :( Any ideas?

How do you gain access to the EIS? If it's through JNDI, then the 
MockEJB package provides a MockContext (fake JNDI context) where you can 
bind whatever object you want for each test. I assume your EIS 
implements some Java interface, so you can easily fake it or mock it 
according to your needs.

Good luck.
